commit_list.message:
Fix appending to large files (>4GB) on Windows

Append mode doesn't work for files larger that 4GB on Windows.
Caused by incorrect usage of SetFilePointer in win_efile.c.

Fix uses OVERLAPPED structure to specify write position (EOF).
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365747.aspx

Opening file in append mode was also considered, but rejected, because
it might cause backwards incompatibility by limiting applicable
operations on the descriptor.

SetFilePointerEx was not used because it would caused more system calls
than using OVERLAPPED structure.

Fix appending to large files (>4GB) on Windows

Append mode doesn't work for files larger that 4GB on Windows.
Caused by incorrect usage of SetFilePointer in win_efile.c.

Fix uses OVERLAPPED structure to specify write position (EOF).
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365747.aspx

Opening file in append mode was also considered, but rejected, because
it might cause backwards incompatibility by limiting applicable
operations on the descriptor.

SetFilePointerEx was not used because it would caused more system calls
than using OVERLAPPED structure.

commit_list.message:
Make port compilation template configurable

- Port compiler no longer requires bash on windows.
- It's possible to use compilers whose command lines don't fit into
  the default template

commit_list.repo_description: Erlang build tool that makes it easy to compile and test Erlang applications and releases.

commit_list.message:
Port rebar_file_utils to Windows

Modify rm_rf and cp_r to work when {win32,_} = os:type().
Simplify rm_rf to only accept one filename, directoryname or wildcard.
Add unit tests to ensure a similar behaviour on windows and unix.

Thanks to tuncer for guidance and feedback.
commit_list.repo_description: Erlang build tool that makes it easy to compile and test Erlang applications and releases.

commit_list.message:
Improve rebar.bat

Add support for invoking rebar from other than current directory.
For example: ..\rebar create-node nodeid=mysample

requires rebar.bar and rebar (escript) to be in the same directory.
commit_list.repo_description: Erlang build tool that makes it easy to compile and test Erlang applications and releases.

commit_list.message: Use file:change_mode/2 instead of invoking chmod
commit_list.repo_description: Erlang build tool that makes it easy to compile and test Erlang applications and releases.

commit_list.message:
Unify executable invocation

Add flags to rebar_utils:sh to control output and error handling.
Replace calls to os:cmd with calls to rebar_utils:sh.
commit_list.repo_description: Erlang build tool that makes it easy to compile and test Erlang applications and releases.

commit_list.message:
Fix bug 805

Use rebar_utils:find_executable/1 that wraps the
path in quotes to make it work even if it contains
whitespace.

commit_list.message:
Refactor:

Drop on-error. Default handlers weren't useful.
Add interleave function.

Change filter argument order.

Makes it easier to construct pipelines with ->.

Fix appending to large files (>4GB) on Windows

Append mode doesn't work for files larger that 4GB on Windows.
Caused by incorrect usage of SetFilePointer in win_efile.c.

Fix uses OVERLAPPED structure to specify write position (EOF).
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365747.aspx

Opening file in append mode was also considered, but rejected, because
it might cause backwards incompatibility by limiting applicable
operations on the descriptor.

SetFilePointerEx was not used because it would caused more system calls
than using OVERLAPPED structure.

Make port compilation template configurable

- Port compiler no longer requires bash on windows.
- It's possible to use compilers whose command lines don't fit into
  the default template

move destination determination to separate fun

Fix appending to large files (>4GB) on Windows

Append mode doesn't work for files larger that 4GB on Windows.
Caused by incorrect usage of SetFilePointer in win_efile.c.

Fix uses OVERLAPPED structure to specify write position (EOF).
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365747.aspx

Opening file in append mode was also considered, but rejected, because
it might cause backwards incompatibility by limiting applicable
operations on the descriptor.

SetFilePointerEx was not used because it would caused more system calls
than using OVERLAPPED structure.
